New Records: First comeback win coming this late in the season
Key Match Events: Zach DeLoach and Bryan Ramos hit back-to-back doubles, scoring one run
Lenyn Sosa walked, prompting a pitching change from the Angels
Luis Robert Jr. hit a run-scoring single to give the Sox a lead
Justin Anderson locked down his first save of the season
Post-Match Reflections: The White Sox tied the Mets' record on Sunday night in San Diego, which set them up to break it at home under the bright lights of Guaranteed Rate Field
I'm glad we got it done tonight

The announced crowd was right around their season average. The game marked the start of “Fan Appreciation Week,” and it was also “Dog Day,” where fans could bring their pooches and sit in the outfield
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sox were 0-94 when trailing after seven innings this season and they found themselves down 1-0 when Angels first baseman Eric Wagaman drove in Kevin Pillar with a double
The Sox were down 2-0 in the top of the eighth inning when Jack López hit a solo homer, the first of his career
You could hear the barking from the press box. It was a refreshing change from the boos
It would’ve been fitting if the floodgates opened and the Angels scored a bunch of runs and everyone went home happy they witnessed history. But that didn’t happen
